intro: Fagara coco var. formosana, commonly known as the Formosan cocoa tree, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to Taiwan. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and small, fragrant white flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain a single seed, which is used for cocoa production. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in montane forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical collections.
